Request: What should a patient know about this drug
Framing: I am a pharmacist doing patient consults
Shots: Omeprazole is used to treat excess stomach acid in conditions such as non cancerous stomach ulcers, gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), active duodenal ulcer, Zollinger-Ellison syndrome and erosive esophagitis. Omeprazole works by blocking gastric acid production and is from the group of medicines called proton pump inhibitors.

Request: What are the interactions with this drug
Framing: I am a pharmacist looking up drug interations on Drugs.com
Shots: There are 220 drugs known to interact with omeprazole, along with 3 disease interactions. Of the total drug interactions, 22 are major, 151 are moderate, and 47 are minor. For more details please check https://www.drugs.com/drug-interactions/omeprazole-index.html

Request: Will this drug help relieve pain for my patient
Framing: I am a doctor prescribing medications to a patient
Shots: Famotidine is usually the first choice to treat occasional heartburn if your symptoms occur less than two times per week. For more details please check https://www.drugs.com/search.php?searchterm=omeprazole&sources[]=medical-answers

Request: Where can I purchase this drug for the best price
Framing: I am a hosptial administrator trying to source drugs for the best price
Shots: Pharmaceutical distribution services are available directly from the drug manufacturers. Medical service companies like McKesson Corporation also do pharmaceutical distribution.

Framing: I am a policy maker trying to assess which drugs should be controlled by law
Shots: Omeprazole is not a controlled drug. More details are available from the U.S. Department of Justice, Drug Enforcement Administration schedule of controlled substances. An alphabetically ordered list of controlled substances is available on their website, at https://www.deadiversion.usdoj.gov/schedules/

Request: Help me to understand what this drug does
Framing: I am a layperson trying to understand the drugs I was prescribed
Shots: Omeprazole delayed-release capsules, USP, are indicated for short-term treatment of active duodenal ulcer in adults. Most patients heal within four weeks. Some patients may require an additional four weeks of therapy. For more details please check https://www.drugs.com/pro/omeprazole.html

Request: What is the generic name of this drug
Framing: I am an FDA analyst trying to assess what is the generic form of a drug
Shots: Omeprazole is the generic name for Prilosec
